alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:32PM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Halifax and Northampton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to 15.9 feet through Friday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 14.3 Wed 7 pm EST 15.4 15.9 15.9 15.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 845 AM EST.
